text: hello this is Bill Cunningham on the
fashion watch of Fifth Avenue and while
the majority of women and men wear
practical clothing to keep warm meeting
down coats and layers whatever there is
a small core group of people who are
still keenly interested in fashion and
this year I saw it in the cloth coat and
it's not just a single coat made of a
single fabric what looked to be
interesting is the coat made of three
different fabrics all put together and I
saw one morning five women passed me on
the way to work all wearing the same
coat the front of it was a houndstooth
pattern and it was tweed and the back of
the coat and the sleeves were gray
flannel and on the cuff was black
leather so with the mixture of textures
in the mixture of fabrics that seemed to
be telling us something new about what i
would call dress coats and yes all the
same thing on men a mixture of plaids
solid black and gray flannel sleeves or
leather sleeves and then the other thing
that I noticed about cloth coats this
year women who were wearing all the
shades of gray as an alternative to
black at the moment the main story are
cloth coats made from a mixture of
fabrics they're not patchwork system
really started two years ago with cloth
coats with leather sleeves
and I think this is an evolution of the
idea
